acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 1 from rabbit dermal LD50= 0.21mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Saturated concentration is 459406ppm, and it is guessed that each inhalation study is done in the state of steam. Since there is no data about mists, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: It was classified as Category 1 from rat inhalation LC50 = 7.47ppm/4H (ACGIH (2001)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 3 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 71 mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001)

carcinogenicity.rationale: In male and female rats and mice, pheochromocytoma to the adrenal gland and slight increases of adenoma to the pancreas is reported only in the male rats(HSDB (2005)). However, it could not be said to be sufficient evidence for a classification, and it was presupposed that it cannot be classified.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances with boiling point of >55degC are not available. Boiling point: 39 degC (Hommel, 1991)

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 2 because of its flash point: -7 degC (ICSC (J), 2003), boiling point:  39 degC (Hommel, 1991)

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on two reports of the epidemiologic survey that in the mouse inhalation study, bone marrow chromosomal aberration and induction of micronuclei were acknowledged (RTECS, 2004) and that the occurrence frequency of the chromosome aberration was high in the exposured human peripheral blood lymphocyte (in vivo somatic cell information) (HSDB 2005), we categorized it as Category 2.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Since the ignition points is 534 degC (Hommmel (1991)), and exceeds 70 degC, it was classified as the outside of Category.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In the reference (Schardein JL, Chemically induced Birth Defects-3rd edition, Marcel Dekker, New York, 2000) indicated to the technological direction, stillbirth and the abnormal children's delivery are reported as a result of the environmental emmision of this products in Indian plant's incident in 1984. However, it is supposed that an epidemiological study is still more required. Since only the information applicable to Category 1A was not acquired, and it was classified into the Category 1B. In addition, it was reported the increase embryo resorption at dose not affecting maternal body weight in pregnant rat inharation exposure (RTECS (2004)).

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Since asthma is caused as an acute symptoms by humans (ACGIH (2001)), the respiratory sensitization is pointed out(EU R42/43, Chapman (2005)) , and Shianeto system compounds are much indicated by the list of the Japanese occupation and environmental allergology meeting, respiratory sensitization was referred to as Category 1.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified in UNRTDG No. 2480 METHYL ISOCYANATE, Class: 6.1, PGI

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since it was estimated as Severe as a result of Draize test using a rabbit (RTECS (2004)), and irreversibly damage was also reported in humans (ACGIH (2001)), it was set as Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was estimated as Moderate as a result of Draize test on rabbits, and it was reported that it also cause irritations or damages on humans (RTECS (2004)), it was classified as Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since there is a report (ACGIH (2001)) that intracutaneous sensitization tests of the guinea pigs indicated immune responses, the skin sensitization was also referred to as Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since any report were the short administration period and insufficient data, it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there is a report of pulmonary edemas, dyspnea, respiratory distress syndrome etc. by humans (ACGIH (2001), HSDB (2005)) and irritation to the human nose and throat has been reported as well (ACGIH (2001)),  it was set as Category 1 (respiratory tracts).
